jpiv2

Class CmdFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JInternalFrame
            • jpiv2.CmdFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class CmdFrame
extends javax.swing.JInternalFrame
    A text frame providing some editing and scripting functionality. BeanShell script code can be selected and executed within this frame. System output can be redirected to this window also. This component is beeing designed as a child frame of a jpiv2.JPiv() component.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • append

        public void append(java.lang.String str)
        Appends a string at the end of the text.
        Parameters:
        str - The string being appended.

      • executeSelection

        public void executeSelection()
        Hands selected text over to a jpiv2.CmdInterpreter() object. The method automatically gets a handle to the actual jpiv2.CmdInterpreter() object by calling the java2.JPiv.getCmdInterpreter() method.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Deletes the whole text.

      • cut

        public void cut()
        Moves the currently selected text to the system clipboard

        Copies the currently selected text to the system clipboard

        public void paste()
        Copies the currently selected text from the system clipboard

      • replaceSelection

        public void replaceSelection(java.lang.String content)
        Replaces the selected text with 'content'.
        Parameters:
        content - A string that repaces the selection.

      • setNumOfRows

        public void setNumOfRows(int num)
        Sets a new value for the maximum number of rows.
        Parameters:
        num - Maximum number of displayed text lines.

      • setLineWrap

        public void setLineWrap(boolean wrap)
        Activates or deactivates line wrap.
        Parameters:
        wrap - If this value is true the lines are wrapped at the border of the text field. If this value is false a horizontal scroll bar appears in case a line is longer than the width of the text field.

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Returns the text of the text area in a single String
        Returns:
        The text of the JTextArea.
